column4: Hi, does anybody know how I can connect my mp3 player to ubuntu so that it shows up as a hard drive instead of as a picture CD?
if you run sudo fdisk -l you should be able to mount it if its listed, mount it as writable and yuo can load it up
Thanks, I'll try that.
I did what you said but I can't find which one it is in the resulting list. How do I select the right one?
you need to look at the size and filesystem type
Sorry, it doesn't seem to say the size.
can you pastebinn the output please
You mean just copy and paste what's in the terminal?
no to pastebin
Okay thanks, I'll do that.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/104392/
look at the top line of each block
Haha okay, I see it now. Dunno why I didn't notice that. thanks.
you have a 50Gb disk, a 16.5Gb disk and a 500Gb disk
It's the 16.5GB. What do I do now that I know which one it is?
Now that I know what it's called, how do I tell it to be mounted as a hard drive? The computer currently thinks it's a picture CD for osme reason.
well its ntfs formatted and its name is sdc1
exactly the same
Haha okay. Thanks again for your help.
just use /dev/sdc1 instead
or whatever partition is your player
I think it's sdd.
